bl.tools
Class Generator

java.lang.Object
  bl.tools.Generator

public class Generator
extends java.lang.Object

Generates a List of test for execution of the instrumented Rhino version. This list can be passed to jsDriver.pl. All tests would be too much and´ we would have not enough failing tests.

Author:
CO

Field Detail

FAILING_TESTS

private static final java.lang.String FAILING_TESTS
Tests within this sub-directory won`t be sampled. They will all be put in the list file. This is the right place to put the failing tests in - those we generated before.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

location

private static java.lang.String location
Directory where tests can be found.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

Parameters:
args - 1. location of the tests, 2. percent of tests to sample

parseDirs

private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> parseDirs(java.lang.String location)
Generates a set of all sub-directories of the passed location, that do not equal FAILING_TESTS.

Parameters:
location - directory to parse
Returns:
set of sub-directories of location, without FAILING_TESTS

parseSubDirs

private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> parseSubDirs(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> dirs)

Parameters:
dirs - a set of all directories within the specified location
Returns:
a set containing all sub-directories of directories within the specified location. Each item consists of the relative path, beginning at (but without) "location\".

parseTests

private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> parseTests(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> subDirs,
                                                              int percent)
As we walked two levels down in the directory hierarchy, we finally reached the test`s home. Files ending with ".js" found here are assumed to be tests. We collect them with the specified likelihood (%).

Parameters:
subDirs - the set generated by parseSubDirs, percent likelihood for sampling
Returns:
the sampled tests

addFailing

private static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> addFailing(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> list)
The files in FAILING_TESTS, which are left out before, are added here to the passed argument.

Parameters:
list -
Returns:
all we need for a hopefully informative test run

write

private static void write(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> list)
Writes the generated set of tests to rhino`s test directory. The file is named "sampled-tests.ls"

Parameters:
list -
